name: Furosemide

ingredients.name: SODIUM STARCH GLYCOLATE TYPE A POTATO

warningsAndPrecautions: furosemide tablets , usp 20 mg tablets supplied white , flat tablets beveled edges , product identification “ 54 840 ” debossed one side . ndc 0054-8297-25 : unit-dose ( 10 x 10 ) ndc 0054-4297-25 : bottle 100 tabletsndc 0054-4297-31 : bottle 1000 tablets 40 mg tablets supplied white , flat tablets beveled edges , scored one side product identification “ 54 583 ” debossed one side . ndc 0054-8299-25 : unit-dose ( 10 x 10 ) ndc 0054-4299-25 : bottle 100 tabletsndc 0054-4299-31 : bottle 1000 tablets 80 mg tablets supplied white , flat tablets beveled edges , scored one side product identification “ 54 533 ” debossed one side . ndc 0054-8301-25 : unit-dose ( 10 x 10 ) ndc 0054-4301-25 : bottle 100 tabletsndc 0054-4301-29 : bottle 500 tablets store dispense store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) . [ usp controlled room temperature . ] note : dispense tight , light-resistant , child-resistant container defined usp/nf . exposure light may cause slight discoloration . discolored tablets dispensed . protect moisture . protect light . furosemide oral solution , usp 10 mg per ml oral solution supplied ( orange-flavored ) clear , orange-colored solution . ndc 0054-3294-46 : bottle 60 mldispense bottle calibrated oral syringe provided . ndc 0054-3294-50 : bottle 120 ml dispense bottle . protect light . note : discard opened bottle 90 days . 40 mg per 5 ml oral solution supplied ( pineapple-peach flavored ) clear , orange-colored solution . ndc 0054-3298-63 : bottle 500 ml dispense tight , light-resistant , child-resistant container defined usp/nf protect light . store dispense store 20° 25°c ( 68° 77°f ) . adverseReactions: furosemide contraindicated patients anuria patients history hypersensitivity furosemide .
warningsAndPrecautions_original:
Furosemide Tablets, USP
                  
                  
                     
                     
                        
                           
                              
                                 20 mg tablets are supplied as white, flat tablets with beveled edges, product identification “54 840” debossed on one side.
                              
                              NDC 0054-8297-25: Unit-Dose (10 x 10)
                              NDC 0054-4297-25: Bottle of 100 TabletsNDC 0054-4297-31: Bottle of 1000 Tablets
                           
                        
                        
                           
                              
                                 40 mg tablets are supplied as white, flat tablets with beveled edges, scored on one side and product identification “54 583” debossed on one side.
                              
                              NDC 0054-8299-25: Unit-Dose (10 x 10)
                              NDC 0054-4299-25: Bottle of 100 TabletsNDC 0054-4299-31: Bottle of 1000 Tablets
                           
                        
                        
                           
                              
                                 80 mg tablets are supplied as white, flat tablets with beveled edges, scored on one side and product identification “54 533” debossed on one side.
                              
                              NDC 0054-8301-25: Unit-Dose (10 x 10)
                              NDC 0054-4301-25: Bottle of 100 TabletsNDC 0054-4301-29: Bottle of 500 Tablets
                           
                        
                        
                           
                              
                                 Store and Dispense
                                 Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F). [See USP Controlled Room Temperature.]
                              
                                 Note: Dispense in a tight, light-resistant, child-resistant container as defined in the USP/NF. Exposure to light may cause slight discoloration. Discolored tablets should not be dispensed.
                              Protect From Moisture.
                                    PROTECT FROM LIGHT.
                              
                           
                        
                     
                  
                  
                     Furosemide Oral Solution, USP
                  
                  
                     
                     
                        
                           
                              
                                 10 mg per mL oral solution is supplied as a
                                 (orange-flavored) clear, orange-colored solution.
                              
                              NDC 0054-3294-46: Bottle of 60 mLDispense only in this bottle and only with the calibrated oral syringe provided.
                              
                              NDC 0054-3294-50: Bottle of 120 mL
                              Dispense only in this bottle.
                              
                                 PROTECT FROM LIGHT.
                                 
                                 NOTE: DISCARD OPENED BOTTLE AFTER 90 DAYS.
                              
                           
                        
                        
                           
                              
                                 40 mg per 5 mL oral solution is supplied as a
                                 (pineapple-peach flavored) clear, orange-colored solution.
                              
                              NDC 0054-3298-63: Bottle of 500 mL
                              Dispense in a tight, light-resistant, child-resistant container as defined in the USP/NF
                              
                                 PROTECT FROM LIGHT.
                              
                           
                        
                        
                           
                              
                                 Store and Dispense
                                 Store at 20° to 25°C (68° to 77°F). [See USP Controlled Room Temperature.]
                           
                        
                     
                  
                  Distributed by:
                     Hikma Pharmaceuticals USA Inc.
                  
                  Berkeley Heights, NJ 07922
                  
                     C50000360/02
                  
                  
                     Revised April 2025
adverseReactions_original: Furosemide is contraindicated in patients with anuria and in patients with a history of hypersensitivity to furosemide.
